title: Utilities Down, But Losses Limited By Safe-Haven Demand - Utilities Roundup
text:
Shares of power producers fell, but losses were limited by the demand for safe havens.

PG&E shares fell after the bankrupt utility said it may shut off power for more than 600,000 customers across parts of 30 California counties in an effort to reduce the risk of wildfires in these communities.

German utility E.ON's asset-swap deal with rival RWE is likely to boost the company's growth, said analysts at brokerage Deutsche Bank, as reported earlier.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 08, 2019 17:31 ET (21:31 GMT)
